remarks: Rule to change the bound variable in a maps-to function, using implicit substitution.  This version of ~ cbvmpt2 allows ` A ` to be a function of ` y ` , analogous to ~ cbvmpt2x .  (Contributed by AV, 30-Mar-2019.)
statement:
cbvmpt2x2.1 $e |- F/_ z A $.
cbvmpt2x2.2 $e |- F/_ y D $.
cbvmpt2x2.3 $e |- F/_ z C $.
cbvmpt2x2.4 $e |- F/_ w C $.
cbvmpt2x2.5 $e |- F/_ x E $.
cbvmpt2x2.6 $e |- F/_ y E $.
cbvmpt2x2.7 $e |- ( y = z -> A = D ) $.
cbvmpt2x2.8 $e |- ( ( y = z /\ x = w ) -> C = E ) $.
cbvmpt2x2 $p |- ( x e. A , y e. B |-> C ) = ( w e. D , z e. B |-> E ) $.
$d A w $.
$d B w x y z $.
$d D x $.
$d w x y z $.
